properties.areaDesc: Kershaw, SC; Fairfield, SC; Lancaster, SC
properties.headline: Flood Warning issued February 15 at 8:35PM EST by NWS Columbia SC
properties.description:
...The River Flood Warnings Continues for the Following Rivers in
South Carolina..

Congaree River at Carolina Eastman affecting Calhoun...Lexington
and Richland Counties

Congaree River at Congaree National Park-Gadsden Affecting Calhoun
and Richland Counties

Wateree River at Lake Wateree Affecting Fairfield...Kershaw and
Lancaster Counties

.The Congaree River and Wateree River continue to be influenced by
the recent heavy rainfall across the Carolinas. River levels will
fluctuate over the next several days, but gradually recede. Minor
to Moderate river flooding levels will continue through much of
the period. A series of weather systems will bring a chance for
more rainfall Sunday into much of next week.

The Flood Warning continues for Lake Wateree.
* Until further notice...or until the warning is cancelled.
* At 8 PM Saturday the stage was 101.8 feet.
* Flood stage is 100 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...The lake level will be 101 to 102 feet through
Wednesday.
* At 100.5 feet...Several yards and docks in low lying areas around
Lake Wateree begin to flood.
properties.instruction:
Safety message...never drive vehicles through flooded areas. The
water may be too deep to allow safe passage. Never allow children to
play in or near flood waters. Stay tuned to noaa weather radio...
local media or the internet for further statements and updated
forecasts.
